author: NewsWire
text: A U.S. official has alleged wrongdoing by U.S. spy chief Tulsi Gabbard in a complaint that is so highly classified it has sparked months of wrangling over how to share it with Congress, according to people familiar with the matter.

replies.author: CivicsNerd
replies.text: Whoa, this is serious. Military interception shows how high tensions are getting. Wonder how Congress will react?

replies.author: HistoryBuff
replies.text: Russia defying blockades isn’t new, but this could be a diplomatic flashpoint.

replies.author: PatriotTex
replies.text: Interesting. Shows the U.S. is willing to act to uphold sanctions.

author: PoliticsDaily
text: Trump to close Kennedy Center for two years - sparking more controversy over DC venue

replies.author: TruthGuard
replies.text: A single vote majority makes all the difference. Shutdown talks will be tense.

replies.author: Justice4All
replies.text: Republicans now have almost no margin for error in passing bills. Every upcoming vote counts.

replies.author: Watcher
replies.text: Yikes, that’s a razor-thin majority. Any absence could flip the vote.

author: wowsomuchpolitics
text: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-Louisiana) said that he is “confident” he will have enough support from Republicans in the House conference to end the partial government shutdown by Tuesday.

replies.author: Ant Hooper
replies.text: Geopolitics aside, this is mostly a messaging move. NATO relations are at stake.

replies.author: Andreas
replies.text: Even discussing Greenland in 2026 shows how presidential ambitions can create international headlines.

replies.author: JimBoot
replies.text: Security claims vs. feasibility. This is more about political signaling than actual acquisition.

author: USPolitics
text: A federal judge ruled that 5-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos, detained by ICE alongside his father, should not remain in federal custody. Data and analysis suggest ICE is increasingly detaining young children amid President Trump’s mass deportation efforts.

replies.author: RFKStan
replies.text: Interesting to see artists push back against administrative shifts. Cultural institutions are in the spotlight.

replies.author: Heritage83
replies.text: This is a sign of artists taking a stand on how federal policies impact performance and programming.

replies.author: NYCInsider
replies.text: Kennedy Center audiences will feel the effect. Wonder who will fill these shows.
